name: Abductor digiti minimi
text: Abductor digiti minimi (lower extremity, foot). Origin: calcaneal tuberosity; plantar aponeurosis. Insertion: base of proximal phalanx of digit 5; metatarsal 5. Innervation: lateral plantar nerve (S1-S3). Actions: toe abduction and toe flexion at MTP 5; supports longitudinal arch.

name: Abductor hallucis
text: Abductor hallucis (lower extremity, foot). Origin: medial process of calcaneal tuberosity; flexor retinaculum; plantar aponeurosis. Insertion: base of proximal phalanx of great toe. Innervation: medial plantar nerve (S1-S3). Actions: toe abduction and toe flexion at MTP 1; supports longitudinal arch.

name: Adductor brevis
text: Adductor brevis (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: anterior body of pubis; inferior pubic ramus. Insertion: pectineal line of femur; proximal linea aspera. Innervation: obturator nerve (L2-L4). Actions: hip flexion, adduction, and external rotation; stabilizes pelvis.

name: Adductor hallucis (*located in central compartment)
text: Adductor hallucis (lower extremity, foot). Origin: oblique head from bases of metatarsals 2-4, cuboid, lateral cuneiform, and tendon of fibularis longus; transverse head from plantar MTP and deep transverse metatarsal ligaments of toes 3-5. Insertion: lateral base of proximal phalanx of hallux. Innervation: lateral plantar nerve (S2-S3). Actions: toe adduction and toe flexion at MTP 1; supports longitudinal and transverse arches.

name: Adductor longus
text: Adductor longus (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: anterior body of pubis. Insertion: linea aspera (medial lip) of femur. Innervation: obturator nerve (L2-L4). Actions: hip flexion, adduction, and external rotation; stabilizes pelvis.

name: Adductor magnus
text: Adductor magnus (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: adductor part from inferior pubic ramus and ischial ramus; ischiocondylar (hamstring) part from ischial tuberosity. Insertion: adductor part to gluteal tuberosity, linea aspera (medial lip), and medial supracondylar line; ischiocondylar part to adductor tubercle. Innervation: obturator nerve (L2-L4) to adductor part; tibial division of sciatic nerve (L4) to ischiocondylar part. Actions: hip adduction; adductor part assists flexion/external rotation; hamstring part assists extension/internal rotation; stabilizes pelvis.

name: Adductor minimus
text: Adductor minimus (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: inferior pubic ramus. Insertion: gluteal tuberosity of femur. Innervation: obturator nerve (L2-L4) (commonly L2-L3). Actions: hip adduction and external rotation.

name: Biceps femoris
text: Biceps femoris (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: long head from ischial tuberosity and sacrotuberous ligament; short head from linea aspera (lateral lip) and lateral supracondylar line of femur. Insertion: lateral aspect of fibular head. Innervation: long head by tibial division of sciatic nerve (L5-S2); short head by common fibular division of sciatic nerve (L5-S2). Actions: hip extension and external rotation; knee flexion and external rotation; stabilizes pelvis.

name: Dorsal interossei (4)
text: Dorsal interossei (4) (lower extremity, foot). Origin: opposing sides of metatarsals 1-5. Insertion: #1 to medial base of proximal phalanx of digit 2; #2-4 to lateral bases of proximal phalanges and extensor expansions of digits 2-4. Innervation: lateral plantar nerve (S2-S3). Actions: toe abduction and toe flexion at MTP 2-4; toe extension at IP joints 2-4.

name: Extensor digitorum brevis
text: Extensor digitorum brevis (lower extremity, foot). Origin: superolateral calcaneus; interosseous talocalcaneal ligament; inferior extensor retinaculum. Insertion: extensor digitorum longus tendons to toes 2-4. Innervation: deep fibular (peroneal) nerve (L5-S1). Action: toe extension at distal interphalangeal joints 2-4.

name: Extensor digitorum longus
text: Extensor digitorum longus (lower extremity, leg). Origin: proximal half of medial fibula; lateral tibial condyle; interosseous membrane. Insertion: middle and distal phalanges of digits 2-5. Innervation: deep fibular nerve (L4-S1). Actions: toe extension at MTP/IP joints 2-5; ankle dorsiflexion; subtalar eversion.

name: Extensor hallucis brevis
text: Extensor hallucis brevis (lower extremity, foot). Origin: superolateral calcaneus. Insertion: proximal phalanx of great toe. Innervation: deep fibular nerve (L5-S1). Action: toe extension at MTP 1.

name: Extensor hallucis longus
text: Extensor hallucis longus (lower extremity, leg). Origin: middle third of medial fibula; interosseous membrane. Insertion: base of distal phalanx of great toe. Innervation: deep fibular nerve (L5-S1). Actions: toe extension at MTP/IP 1; ankle dorsiflexion.

name: Fibularis brevis
text: Fibularis brevis (lower extremity, leg). Origin: distal two-thirds of lateral fibula; anterior intermuscular septum. Insertion: tuberosity of metatarsal 5. Innervation: superficial fibular nerve (L5-S2). Actions: ankle plantarflexion; subtalar eversion.

name: Fibularis longus
text: Fibularis longus (lower extremity, leg). Origin: fibular head; proximal two-thirds of lateral fibula; anterior and posterior intermuscular septa. Insertion: medial cuneiform; metatarsal 1. Innervation: superficial fibular nerve (L5-S1). Actions: ankle plantarflexion; subtalar eversion; supports longitudinal and transverse arches.

name: Fibularis tertius
text: Fibularis tertius (lower extremity, leg). Origin: distal third of medial fibula; anterior intermuscular septum. Insertion: dorsal base of metatarsal 5. Innervation: deep fibular nerve (L4-S1). Actions: ankle dorsiflexion; subtalar eversion.

name: Flexor digiti minimi brevis
text: Flexor digiti minimi brevis (lower extremity, foot). Origin: base of metatarsal 5; long plantar ligament. Insertion: base of proximal phalanx of digit 5. Innervation: lateral plantar nerve (S2-S3). Action: toe flexion at MTP 5.

name: Flexor digitorum brevis
text: Flexor digitorum brevis (lower extremity, foot). Origin: medial process of calcaneal tuberosity; plantar aponeurosis. Insertion: middle phalanges of digits 2-5. Innervation: medial plantar nerve (S1-S3). Actions: toe flexion at MTP 2-5; supports longitudinal arch.

name: Flexor digitorum longus
text: Flexor digitorum longus (lower extremity, leg). Origin: posterior tibia inferior to soleal line. Insertion: bases of distal phalanges of digits 2-5. Innervation: tibial nerve (L5-S2). Actions: toe flexion at MTP/IP joints 2-5; ankle plantarflexion; subtalar inversion.

name: Flexor hallucis brevis
text: Flexor hallucis brevis (lower extremity, foot). Origin: tendon of tibialis posterior; medial cuneiform; lateral cuneiform; cuboid. Insertion: medial and lateral aspects of base of proximal phalanx of hallux (via sesamoids). Innervation: medial plantar nerve (S1-S2). Actions: toe flexion at MTP 1; supports longitudinal arch.

name: Flexor hallucis longus
text: Flexor hallucis longus (lower extremity, leg). Origin: distal two-thirds posterior fibula; interosseous membrane; posterior intermuscular septum; fascia of tibialis posterior. Insertion: base of distal phalanx of great toe. Innervation: tibial nerve (S2-S3). Actions: toe flexion at MTP/IP 1; ankle plantarflexion; subtalar inversion.

name: Gastrocnemius
text: Gastrocnemius (lower extremity, leg). Origin: lateral head from posterolateral lateral femoral condyle; medial head from posterior medial femoral condyle and popliteal surface of femoral shaft. Insertion: posterior calcaneus via calcaneal (Achilles) tendon. Innervation: tibial nerve (S1-S2). Actions: ankle plantarflexion; knee flexion.

name: Gluteus maximus
text: Gluteus maximus (lower extremity, hip). Origin: posterolateral sacrum and coccyx; gluteal surface of ilium posterior to posterior gluteal line; thoracolumbar fascia; sacrotuberous ligament. Insertion: iliotibial tract; gluteal tuberosity of femur. Innervation: inferior gluteal nerve (L5-S2). Actions: hip extension; hip external rotation; hip abduction (superior fibers); hip adduction (inferior fibers).

name: Gluteus medius
text: Gluteus medius (lower extremity, hip). Origin: gluteal surface of ilium between anterior and posterior gluteal lines. Insertion: lateral greater trochanter. Innervation: superior gluteal nerve (L4-S1). Actions: hip abduction; hip internal rotation (anterior fibers); pelvic stabilization.

name: Gluteus minimus
text: Gluteus minimus (lower extremity, hip). Origin: gluteal surface of ilium between anterior and inferior gluteal lines. Insertion: anterior greater trochanter. Innervation: superior gluteal nerve (L4-S1). Actions: hip abduction; hip internal rotation; pelvic stabilization.

name: Gracilis
text: Gracilis (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: body of pubis; inferior pubic ramus; ischial ramus. Insertion: medial proximal tibia via pes anserinus. Innervation: obturator nerve (L2-L3). Actions: hip flexion; hip adduction; knee flexion; knee internal rotation.

name: Iliacus
text: Iliacus (lower extremity, hip). Origin: iliac fossa. Insertion: lesser trochanter (via iliopsoas tendon). Innervation: femoral nerve (L2-L4). Actions: hip flexion (thigh/trunk); hip external rotation.

name: Inferior gemellus
text: Inferior gemellus (lower extremity, hip). Origin: ischial tuberosity. Insertion: medial surface of greater trochanter via obturator internus tendon. Innervation: nerve to quadratus femoris (L4-S1). Actions: hip external rotation; hip abduction from flexed hip; stabilizes femoral head in acetabulum.

name: Lumbricals (4)
text: Lumbricals (4) (lower extremity, foot). Origin: tendons of flexor digitorum longus. Insertion: medial bases of proximal phalanges and extensor expansions of digits 2-5. Innervation: lumbrical 1—medial plantar nerve (S2-S3); lumbricals 2-4—lateral plantar nerve (S2-S3). Actions: MTP 2-5 flexion; toe adduction; IP 2-5 extension.

name: Obturator externus
text: Obturator externus (lower extremity, hip). Origin: anterior surface of obturator membrane and bony margins of obturator foramen. Insertion: trochanteric fossa of femur. Innervation: obturator nerve (L3-L4). Actions: hip external rotation; hip abduction from flexed hip; stabilizes femoral head in acetabulum.

name: Obturator internus
text: Obturator internus (lower extremity, hip). Origin: ischiopubic ramus and posterior surface of obturator membrane. Insertion: medial surface of greater trochanter of femur. Innervation: nerve to obturator internus (L5-S1). Actions: hip external rotation; hip abduction from flexed hip; stabilizes femoral head in acetabulum.

name: Opponens digiti minimi
text: Opponens digiti minimi (lower extremity, foot). Origin: long plantar ligament; base of 5th metatarsal; tendon sheath of fibularis longus. Insertion: lateral border of 5th metatarsal. Innervation: lateral plantar nerve (S2-S3). Actions: toe abduction and toe flexion at MTP joint 5.

name: Pectineus
text: Pectineus (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: superior pubic ramus (pectineal line). Insertion: pectineal line of femur and proximal linea aspera. Innervation: femoral nerve (L2-L3); may receive obturator contribution (L2-L3). Actions: hip flexion; hip adduction; hip external rotation; hip internal rotation; pelvic stabilization.

name: Piriformis
text: Piriformis (lower extremity, hip). Origin: anterior sacrum (between S2 and S4); gluteal surface of ilium near posterior inferior iliac spine; may include sacrotuberous ligament. Insertion: apex/superior border of greater trochanter. Innervation: nerve to piriformis (S1-S2). Actions: hip external rotation; hip abduction from flexed hip; stabilizes femoral head in acetabulum.

name: Plantar interossei (3)
text: Plantar interossei (3) (lower extremity, foot). Origin: medial aspects of metatarsals 3-5. Insertion: medial bases of proximal phalanges and extensor expansions of digits 3-5. Innervation: lateral plantar nerve (S2-S3). Actions: MTP 3-5 flexion; toe adduction; IP 3-5 extension.

name: Plantaris
text: Plantaris (lower extremity, leg). Origin: lateral supracondylar line of femur and oblique popliteal ligament. Insertion: calcaneal tuberosity via calcaneal (Achilles) tendon. Innervation: tibial nerve (S1-S2). Actions: ankle plantarflexion; knee flexion.

name: Popliteus
text: Popliteus (lower extremity, leg). Origin: lateral femoral condyle and posterior horn of lateral meniscus. Insertion: posterior surface of proximal tibia. Innervation: tibial nerve (L5-S2). Actions: unlocks knee (medially rotates tibia on femur / laterally rotates femur on tibia); stabilizes knee.

name: Psoas major
text: Psoas major (lower extremity, hip). Origin: vertebral bodies T12-L4; intervertebral discs T12-L4; transverse processes L1-L5. Insertion: lesser trochanter via iliopsoas tendon. Innervation: anterior rami of L1-L3 (variable, may include L4). Actions: hip flexion; trunk flexion; trunk lateral flexion.

name: Psoas minor
text: Psoas minor (lower extremity, hip). Origin: vertebral bodies T12 and L1. Insertion: iliopubic eminence and pectineal line of pubis. Innervation: anterior ramus of L1. Actions: weak trunk flexion.

name: Quadratus femoris
text: Quadratus femoris (lower extremity, hip). Origin: ischial tuberosity. Insertion: intertrochanteric crest of femur. Innervation: nerve to quadratus femoris (L4-S1). Actions: hip external rotation; stabilizes femoral head in acetabulum.

name: Quadratus plantae
text: Quadratus plantae (lower extremity, foot). Origin: medial surface of calcaneus and lateral process of calcaneal tuberosity. Insertion: tendon of flexor digitorum longus. Innervation: lateral plantar nerve (S1-S3). Actions: toe flexion at MTP joints 2-5 (assists FDL).

name: Rectus femoris
text: Rectus femoris (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: anterior inferior iliac spine and supra-acetabular groove. Insertion: patella and tibial tuberosity via patellar ligament. Innervation: femoral nerve (L2-L4). Actions: hip flexion; knee extension.

name: Sartorius
text: Sartorius (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: anterior superior iliac spine (ASIS). Insertion: proximal medial tibia via pes anserinus. Innervation: femoral nerve (L2-L4). Actions: hip flexion; hip abduction; hip external rotation; knee flexion; knee internal rotation.

name: Semimembranosus
text: Semimembranosus (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: ischial tuberosity. Insertion: posterior medial condyle of tibia. Innervation: tibial division of sciatic nerve (L5-S2). Actions: hip extension; hip internal rotation; knee flexion; knee internal rotation; stabilizes pelvis.

name: Semitendinosus
text: Semitendinosus (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: ischial tuberosity. Insertion: proximal medial tibia via pes anserinus. Innervation: tibial division of sciatic nerve (L5-S2). Actions: hip extension; knee flexion; knee medial rotation (internal rotation).

name: Soleus
text: Soleus (lower extremity, leg). Origin: soleal line and medial tibia; head of fibula; posterior fibula. Insertion: calcaneal tuberosity via calcaneal (Achilles) tendon. Innervation: tibial nerve (S1-S2). Actions: ankle plantarflexion.

name: Superior gemellus
text: Superior gemellus (lower extremity, hip). Origin: ischial spine. Insertion: medial surface of greater trochanter via obturator internus tendon. Innervation: nerve to obturator internus (L5-S1). Actions: hip external rotation; hip abduction from flexed hip; stabilizes femoral head in acetabulum.

name: Tensor fasciae latae
text: Tensor fasciae latae (lower extremity, hip). Origin: ASIS and anterior outer lip of iliac crest. Insertion: iliotibial tract. Innervation: superior gluteal nerve (L4-S1). Actions: hip internal rotation (and weak abduction); helps stabilize hip and knee via IT band; may assist knee flexion/extension depending on position.

name: Tibialis anterior
text: Tibialis anterior (lower extremity, leg). Origin: lateral tibial condyle; proximal half lateral tibia; interosseous membrane. Insertion: medial cuneiform and base of 1st metatarsal. Innervation: deep fibular nerve (L4-L5). Actions: ankle dorsiflexion; subtalar inversion; supports medial longitudinal arch.

name: Tibialis posterior
text: Tibialis posterior (lower extremity, leg). Origin: posterior tibia; posterior fibula; interosseous membrane. Insertion: navicular tuberosity; cuneiforms; bases of metatarsals 2-4; may include cuboid. Innervation: tibial nerve (L4-L5). Actions: ankle plantarflexion; subtalar inversion; supports medial longitudinal arch.

name: Vastus intermedius
text: Vastus intermedius (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: anterior and lateral surface of femoral shaft. Insertion: patella and tibial tuberosity via patellar ligament. Innervation: femoral nerve (L2-L4). Actions: knee extension.

name: Vastus lateralis
text: Vastus lateralis (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: greater trochanter and lateral lip of linea aspera. Insertion: patella and tibial tuberosity via patellar ligament; contributes to lateral patellar retinaculum; may attach near lateral tibial condyle. Innervation: femoral nerve (L2-L4). Actions: knee extension.

name: Vastus medialis
text: Vastus medialis (lower extremity, thigh). Origin: intertrochanteric line; spiral line; linea aspera; medial supracondylar line. Insertion: patella and tibial tuberosity via patellar ligament; contributes to medial patellar retinaculum; may attach near medial tibial condyle. Innervation: femoral nerve (L2-L4). Actions: knee extension.
